newsitem.title: USA: O'Bannon sworn in as Indiana governor.
newsitem.headline: O'Bannon sworn in as Indiana governor.

text.p: Frank O'Bannon shed his lieutenant governor's title to become Indiana's governor Monday during a swearing in ceremony in Indianapolis.
In his inaugural speech, O'Bannon said the state has a strong foundation that includes a "thriving economy" and one of the largest budget surpluses in the nation.
Looking forward, O'Bannon said that education was key to the state's future.
O'Bannon, a Democrat, succeeded two-term Democrat Gov. Evan Bayh, who was prohibited from running for a third term.
O'Bannon defeated Indianapolis Mayor Steve Goldsmith, his Republican opponent, in the Nov. 5 gubernatorial election.
